meanings.definition: A dung heap or compost pile.
meanings.sent1: The farmer added more waste to the mixen behind the barn.
meanings.sent2: The mixen in the garden was full of decomposing leaves and food scraps.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous raccoon found a cozy spot in the mixen to take a nap.
meanings.sent4: The steam rising from the mixen created a mysterious fog in the moonlight.
meanings.sent5: The mixen emitted a pungent odor that could be smelled from afar.

meanings.sent1: She used a large spoon to mixen the ingredients in the bowl.
meanings.sent2: The chef carefully mixen the spices to create a delicious sauce.
meanings.sent3: The children decided to mixen all the paint colors together for a unique masterpiece.
meanings.sent4: His words seemed to mixen truth and fiction in a confusing tale.
meanings.sent5: The swirling winds seemed to mixen the leaves into a colorful whirlwind.
